result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert D. Naugle was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert D. Naugle in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Robert D. Naugle in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the PSI.  Court questions the defense.  Atty Gumz states that they have received the PSI and has no changes.
Atty Hendee states that normally the State would be recommending a Prison sentence on a case like this.  However, the State is requesting Probation today and makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:   Withhold Sentence; 3 years Probation with conditions:
6 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
Good Time
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program & Challange Incarceration Program
Credit = 71 days, counting today (if revoked)
DNA Sample + Surcharge (if not done so already)
Pay $600 + costs = $1,494.00
3 years DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Payment of Supervision fees.
Payment of Court obligations.
Comply with any and all treatment recommended by the Agent
Maintain Absolute Sobriety
No consumption of a controlled substance or alcohol
Not be on the premises of any bars, taverns or liquor stores
bond to be applied to the DNA surcharge

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Atty Gumz states that the defendant has an eye Dr. appointment and asks for 3 days to report.  Atty Gumz asks for an exemption of Ignition Interlock on some unused vehicles and gives that order to the court.
Atty Hendee takes no position on the exemption but objects on the request for a 3 day stay of the sentence.

BY THE COURT:  Court will grant the exemptions and signs the order.
Court denies the request for 3 day stay and Jail will begin forthwith.
Huber will include the Eye Care needs.


4:20pm
Atty Gumz asks the court to recall this case.
Atty Gumz asks to serve in Sauk County and requests out of county work.
Atty Hendee does not object.

BY THE COURT:  JOC to be amended:
May serve in Sauk County
Huber may be used for out of county employment from Marquette County Jail.
COPIES PLACED IN ATTY'S SHELVES
Sentencing hearing on March 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Robert D. Naugle in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 1 in 14CF49.  Charges in 14CF49 Cts 2-3, 14CF61, 14TR969, 14TR970 & 14TR971 will be dismissed.  Parties will request a PSI.  Atty Gumz agrees.
Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 1 in 14CF49.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.
  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF49.  All other charges in 14CF49 Cts 2-3, 14CF61, 14TR969, 14TR970 & 14TR971 are to be dismissed.

**PSI ordered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond ordered revoked and defendant is remanded into the custody of the Marquette County Sheriff's Department forthwith.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on January 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Robert D. Naugle in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF49, 14CF61, 14TR969, 970 & 971 TRACKING TOGETHER:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will be reporting to jail once the plea is done.  Atty Gumz asks for a plea date in January.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on November 12, 2014 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Robert D. Naugle in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF49, 14CF61 & TRAFFIC MATTERS TRACKING TOGETHER
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim on both Felony matters and asks for an Arraignment be set.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of the Prelim on both felony cases.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information in both cases.  
  Defendant received a copy of the information in both cases & waives the reading.  
BY THE COURT:  Set for Arraignment.
bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert D. Naugle

Prior: 298 Elk Ave, Oxford, WI 53952
Motion hearing on September 15, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Mark J. Gumz by phone.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also heard with 14TR969, 14TR970 & 14TR971.
Atty Hendee states after reviewing the motion by Atty Gumz and in speaking with him, believes there will not need to be a full hearing on this matter.  Requests a short period of time to finish his review.  Court questions Atty Hendee.  Atty Gumz agrees with the summation by Atty Hendee.  BY THE COURT:  Defendant's motion will be reset to September.  Will take up the issue of the motion if it still exists or handle the preliminary hearing at that time.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 10:30 am.
LETTER FROM ATTY GUMZ REQUESTING PHONE APPEARANCE ON 8/15/14- COURT APPROVED

14TR969 - Possess Open Intox in MV
14TR970- Non-Registration of Auto
14TR071 - License Reg Violation - Class D or M Vehicle
These cases are tracking w/14CF49

Defendant Robert D. Naugle in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states, based on the motion filed by Atty Gumz, this preliminary hearing should be rescheduled.  Atty Gumz agrees.
BY THE OUCRT:  Reset.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 10:30 am.

with conditions:

Defendant Robert D. Naugle in court with attorney Mark J Gumz / student intern Steve Hughes.  Defendant Robert D. Naugle in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. 
Atty Hendee requests a $250 cash bond with conditions:  Absolute Sobriety
